column4: I am trying to do this... - http://askubuntu.com/questions/123474/how-do-i-use-a-ntfs-drive-as-location-for-music-videos-etc : but I havn't run the ln -s command yet.. shouldn't I need to add the source directory in that ln -s command? Somthing like ln -s ~/Pictures /media/Data/Pictures ?
if you "man ln" without the quotes it gives you the syntax
ln [OPTION]... TARGET is the second form
the first parameter is the TARGET for the symlink, if you don't supply a LINK_NAME it will place it in the current directory with the same name as the TARGET, in my experience

yes you're making sense
the only reference to symlinks I'm seeing on your link is "ln -s /path/to/drive2/mount-point/Videos", is that to what you are referring?

the first argument to ln is always the TARGET. With no LINK_NAME argument it will place the link in your current working directory
What dose it call the link?
so if you run that command in your home directory, the created link will reside in your home directory
it will be the exact same as the TARGET identifier

if you're a bit nervous about running the command, you can create some test files and directories to get a feel for it
